name: Disable Health Pickups (DM)
description: Disables players from picking up items which restore health

name: Disallow health (In Deathmatch)
description: Prevents health from spawning on the map.

name: Disable Powerups (DM)
description: Disables players from picking up and using powerup items

name: Disallow powerups (In Deathmatch)
description: Prevents powerups from spawning on the map.

name: Weapons Stay (DM)
description: Weapons aren't removed from the map when a player picks them up; Doesn't work with weapons dropped by enemies

name: Weapons stay (In Deathmatch)
description: Weapons remain after being picked up by a player.

name: Falling Damage (Old)
description: Damages the player when they fall too far; uses old ZDoom damage calculation

name: Falling Damage (ZDoom)
description: Enables the falling damage used from ZDoom. (Combining both values for ZDoom and Hexen enables the falling damage used from Strife. The minimum amount of damage you take from falling in Strife is 52. Ouch!)

name: Falling damage (Hexen)
description: Damages the player when they fall too far; uses Hexen's damage calculation

name: Falling damage (Hexen)
description: Enables the stronger but less aggressive falling damage used from Hexen. (Combining both values for ZDoom and Hexen enables the falling damage used from Strife. The minimum amount of damage you take from falling in Strife is 52. Ouch!)

name: Falling damage (Strife)
description: Damages the player when they fall too far; uses Strife's damage calculation.  Combining both values for ZDoom and Hexen enables the falling damage used from Strife. The minimum amount of damage you take from falling in Strife is 52. Ouch!

name: Stay on the same map (In Deathmatch)
description: Stay on the same map when someone exits.

name: Same Map (DM)
description: After exiting, the current map is started over instead of proceeding to the next

name: Spawn Farthest (DM)
description: Tries to spawn players far away from each other in a Deathmatch game

name: Spawn farthest (In Deathmatch)
description: Spawn players as far as possible from other players.

name: Force Respawn
description: Forces the player to respawn a few seconds after death

name: Force respawn (In Deathmatch)
description: Forces the players that were killed to respawn. Requires alwaysapplydmflags to be 'true' to have an effect outside of deathmatch mode.

name: Disable Armor (DM)
description: Disables players from picking up items which give armor

name: Disallow armor (In Deathmatch)
description: Prevents armor from spawning on the map.

name: Disable Exit (DM)
description: Trying to exit the level by normal means will kill the offending player

name: Disallow exit (In Deathmatch)
description: Kill anyone that tries to exit from the map.

name: Infinite Ammo
description: All players have infinite ammo

name: Infinite Ammo
description: Players have infinite ammo.

name: No Monsters
description: Monsters placed in the map don't appear; does not stop monsters from spawning via scripts, however

name: No Monsters
description: Monsters do not spawn on the map.

name: Monsters Respawn
description: Monsters who are killed automatically respawn; this is the default behavior for the Nightmare skill setting

name: Monsters Respawn
description: Monsters will respawn sometime after their death.

name: Items Respawn
description: Basic items, such as weapons and ammo, respawn after being picked up

name: Items Respawn
description:
Items respawn after being picked up by a player. However, mega powerups (i.e: invisibility, invulnerability) will not respawn.
Note: Doom's 'RadSuit' and Heretic's 'Wings of Wrath' will always respawn in survival regardless of this CVar's value.

name: Fast Monsters
description: Monsters move and react faster; this is the default behavior for the Nightmare skill setting

name: Fast Monsters
description: Monsters are more aggressive, and both they and projectiles use their FastSpeed property instead of their speed.

name: Disable Jump
description: Players are disabled from jumping; can be overridden in the MAPINFO lump

name: Disallow Jump
description: Prevents players from jumping.

name: Disable Freelook
description: Players are disabled from looking up and down; can be overridden in the MAPINFO lump

name: Disallow Freelook
description: Prevents the players from being able to freelook.

name: Mega powerups respawn
description: Allows mega powerups (i.e: invisibility, invulnerability) to respawn. Requires sv_itemrespawn to be 'true'.

name: Disable FOV
description: Players are disabled from changing their FOV (Field of Vision) from the default

name: Disallow FOV
description: Disallows the clients to use a different Field of View value. [Default: 90]

name: Disable Multi Weapons (Coop)
description: Weapons marked as Multiplayer Only in the map won't appear in Cooperative games

name: Don't spawn multiplayer weapons (In Cooperative)
description: Prevents 'multiplayer only' weapons from spawning.

name: Disable Crouch
description: Players are disabled from crouching; can be overridden in the MAPINFO lump

name: Disallow Crouch
description: Disallow players' ability to crouch.

name: Lose entire inventory (Coop)
description: Players lose everything in their inventory upon death (Coop only)

name: Lose inventory (In Cooperative)
description: Players lose all of their inventory when killed.

name: Lose Keys (Coop)
description: Players lose keys upon death (Coop only)

name: Lose keys (In Cooperative)
description: Players will lose all of their keys when killed.

name: Lose Weapons (Coop)
description: Players lose all weapons upon death and are given the standard pistol and 50 bullets on respawn (Coop only)

name: Lose weapons (In Cooperative)
description: Players will lose all of their weapons when killed.

name: Lose Armor (Coop)
description: Armor is reset to 0% on death (Coop only)

name: Lose armor (In Cooperative)
description: Players will lose all of their armor when killed.

name: Lose Powerups (Coop)
description: Powerups are lost on death (Coop only)

name: Lose powerups (In Cooperative)
description: Players will lose all of their powerups when killed.

name: Lose Ammo (Coop)
description: Ammo is lost on death and the player starts with only 50 bullets (Coop only)

name: Lose ammo (In Cooperative)
description: Players will lose all their ammo when killed.

name: Lose half ammo (Coop)
description: Half of the player's ammo is removed on death (Coop only)

name: Lose half ammo
description: Players lose half of their ammo when killed.

name: Allow jumping override
description: Allows the players to jump regardless of the MAPINFO NoJumping argument.

name: Allow crouch override
description: Allow players to crouch regardless of the NoCrouch flag on the MAPINFO lump.

name: Drop Weapon
description: Drops the player's currently selected weapon on death

name: Drop Weapons
description: Players drop their current weapon when killed or fragged.

name: Don't spawn runes
description: Prevents runes from spawning on the map.

name: Instant flag return (ST/CTF)
description: Flags are instantly returned when the carriers are fragged.

name: No team changing (DM)
description: Players cannot change teams in a teamplay match after the map has started

name: No team switching (ST/CTF)
description: Players cannot change teams after already being on a team.

name: Server picks teams (ST/CTF
description: Players are placed in teams automatically by the server.

name: Double ammo
description: Ammo pickups are doubled

name: Double ammo
description: Double amount of ammo that items give you like skill 0 and 4 do.

name: Health Degeneration
description: Players have their health slowly drained when over 100%

name: Degeneration
description: Players slowly lose health when above 100%, like in Quake.

name: Disable BFG aiming
description: Players are disabled from aiming BFG shots up and down; prevents the BFG from being fired into the ground to generate instant tracers

name: Allow BFG freeaiming
description: Allows the BFG to be fired vertically.

name: Barrels respawn (DM)
description: Respawns barrels in a Deathmatch game

name: Barrels respawn
description: Barrels respawn after being blown up -- only works in non-deathmatch game modes if "alwaysapplydmflags" is true!

name: Respawn protection (DM)
description: Players who are respawning are invulnerable for a few seconds

name: No respawn protection (In Deathmatch)
description: Players do not have temporary invulnerability when respawning.

name: Start with shotgun (In Cooperative)
description: Players will have a shotgun when they spawn.

name: Spawn where died (Coop)
description: Players respawn at the spot they died, unless they died in an instant-death sector (Sector type 115) (Coop only)

name: Spawn where died (In Cooperative)
description: Players respawn at the same location they were killed at.

name: Keep teams
description: Players that were already in teams before the map change will continue to be on the same team on the next map.

name: Keep frags gained (DM)
description: Players keep their frag count from one map to the next

name: Keep frags
description: The clients frags are never reset when advancing to the next map.

name: No respawn
description: Players cannot respawn after dying

name: No respawning
description: Players can not respawn once killed or fragged.

name: Lose frag on death (DM)
description: Players lose a frag each time they die

name: Lose frag when fragged
description: When fragged, the player will lose a frag point.

name: Infinite inventory
description: Inventory items aren't removed when used

name: Infinite inventory
description: When true, using an inventory item will not expend it.

name: Force GL defaults
description: If this is enabled, some default OpenGL rendering options are enforced, i.e. clients render as if gl_lightmode == 3, gl_light_ambient == 20.0, and gl_fogmode >= 1. Users can not change the light/brightness (excluding Gamma) in OpenGL once this is enabled. They can toggle between the two fog modes, and gl_fogmode 0 is treated as gl_fogmode 1.

name: No rocket jumping
description: Disallow players from rocket jumping.

name: Award damage instead of kills
description: Players will be awarded points from the damage that they do on monsters, besides awarding by kills.

name: Force alpha
description: If this is enabled, clients are enforced to display alpha, i.e. render as if r_drawtrans was enabled.

name: No monsters to exit
description: Players cannot exit the map until all monsters are killed

name: Kill all monsters (In Cooperative)
description: All monsters must be killed before advancing into the next map.

name: Disable Automap
description: Players cannot access their automap

name: Disallow Automap
description: Disallow players to utilize the Automap.

name: Hide Automap Allies
description: Players cannot see other friendly players on the automap

name: Disallow allies on automap
description: Disallow players to see allies on the Automap.

name: Disable Spying
description: Players cannot use the spynext command to see through their allies' eyes

name: Disallow Spying
description: Disallow players from spying other players.

name: Chasecam cheat
description: Players are allowed to use the third-person chase cam

name: Chasecam
description: Allow the players to utilize the chasecam feature.

name: Disable Suicide
description: Players cannot die due to self-inflicted damage

name: Disallow Suicide
description: Disallow the players to use the 'kill' CCMD.

name: Disable Autoaim
description: Player weapons cannot auto aim

name: Disallow Autoaim
description: Disallow the clients to utilize Autoaim regardless of the players settings.

name: Only spawn single player actors in coop
description: If this is true in a cooperative game mode, map actors are spawned as if the game was single player.

name: Don't switch weapon on empty
description: Disables the weapon auto-switch when player runs out of ammo for that weapon

name: Keep Icon of Sin's spawns after death
description: Keep enemies spawned by Icon of Sin after killing it

name: End sector doesn't count for kill %
description: Makes monsters placed in sectors with the dDamage_End type (as used in Doom E1M8) not count towards the total

name: Big powerups respawn
description: Powerups, such as the Invisibility and Invulnerability, respawn after being picked up

name: Never identify players
description: If this is true, clients can never identify other players when pointing at them.

name: Enforce LMS spectator settings
description: If this is true, lms_spectatorchat will be respected in all game modes.

name: Don't draw Coop Info
description: If true, this disallows clients to utilize the Coop Info CVar regardless if enabled from the clients CVar.

name: Disable unlagged
description: Disables unlagged support for all clients. (default false)

name: Disable player collisions
description: Allows players to pass through each other. Great for small or cramped maps on Multiplayer.

name: No medals
description: When this is set to true, the medals feature will be disabled and will not be displayed nor upkept within the game.

name: Share keys
description: For Cooperative and Survival game modes, when this is set to true, picking up a key gives the key to all players.

name: Keep teams
description: Players that were already in teams before the map change will continue to be on the same team on the next map.

name: Force GL defaults
description: If this is enabled, some default OpenGL rendering options are enforced, i.e. clients render as if gl_lightmode == 3, gl_light_ambient == 20.0, and gl_fogmode == 1. Users can not change the light/brightness (excluding Gamma) in OpenGL once this is enabled.

name: No rocket jumping
description: Disallow players from rocket jumping.

name: Award damage instead of kills
description: Players will be awarded points from the damage that they do on monsters, besides awarding by kills.

name: Force alpha
description: If this is enabled, clients are enforced to display alpha, i.e. render as if r_drawtrans was enabled.

name: Only spawn single player actors in coop
description: If this is true in a cooperative game mode, map actors are spawned as if the game was single player.

name: Emulate vanilla blood brightness.
description: Forces blood brightness to max when damaged.

name: Unblock players on same team
description: Allows players of the same team to pass through each other only.

name: Don't allow dropping
description: Prevents players from dropping items.

name: Find shortest textures like Doom
description: In Doom, AASHITTY in Doom II or AASTINKY in Doom was created to fill in the place of texture index 0, normally treated by the Doom engine as no texture at all. When this is enabled, the "raise platform by lower texture" line special and MAP07 floor raise considers AASHITTY or AASTINKY as a valid texture and uses it's height when raising a platform. If disabled, these textures aren't considered valid and are ignored.

name: Use buggier stair building
description: Causes doom to calculate heights of stairs when stairbuilding from the last (topmost) step, instead of the first (bottom-most) step.

name: Limit pain elementals to 20 lost souls
description: Prevents pain elementals from spawning lost souls if there are 20 or more on the map.

name: Don't let others hear pickups
description: This prevents players from hearing other players picking up items, weapons, or powerups in netgames.

name: Actors are infinitely tall
description: This causes all objects to occupy an infinite vertical space from the ceiling to the floor, which prevents monsters or the player from being able to pass over or under other solid objects, regardless of whether they are touching each other on the Z plane or not.  WARNING: Enabling this will break ZDoom-style thing bridges and objects that rely on height sensitivity.

name: Allow silent BFG trick
description: Forces all actors to play all sounds only on one channel, cutting off any previous sounds the actor has made. Only enable this if you can't live without the silent BFG trick, as it will cripple the sound system and prevent actors from playing any more than one sound at a time.

name: Enable wallrunning
description: This uses a buggier method of collision detection with walls that allows a player to run double average speed when pressing against a vertically-aligned wall.

name: Spawn item drops on the floor
description: Items dropped by monsters appear on the floor below the center of the monster, instead of being tossed from the monster's corpse. May cause items to get stuck in walls or appear at the bottom of pits.

name: All special lines can block use lines
description: Any lines with line specials prevent the player from triggering a usable line behind it, regardless of whether the frontmost line can be used itself or not.

name: Disable Boom door light effect
description: Don't do the BOOM local door light effect

name: Raven's scrollers use original speed
description: Raven's scrollers use their original carrying speed

name: Use sector based sound target code
description: Use sector based sound target code.

name: Limit deh.MaxHealth to health bonus
description: Players can not exceed over the 200% health, as you can with just the normal MaxHealth bonuses.

name: Trace ign. lines w. s. sec on b. sides
description: Trace ignores lines with the same sector on both sides

name: No monster dropoff move
description: Monsters cannot move when hanging over a dropoff

name: Scrolling sectors are additve
description: Scrolling sectors are additive like in Boom

name: Monsters see semi-invisible players
description: Monsters will be able to see the player even if the player has a partial invisibility sphere.

name: Limited movement in the air
description: By default, Zandronum gives players more maneuverability in the air than ZDoom. When this is true, ZDoom’s method is used. See Air Control for more precise details.

name: Plasma bump bug
description: Allows players to pick up items on the other side of solid walls by running into the wall at a specific angle. This flag should only be used for old vanilla Doom maps that really need it; it can have serious side effects on bridges and scrolling floors!

name: Allow instant respawn
description: Allows players to respawn instantly after being killed by holding down the "use" key when being hit.

name: Disable taunts
description: Prevents players from using the "taunt" command.

name: Original sound curve
description: Enabling this uses the original Doom sound curve, which causes sounds to fade away at a shorter distance. When disabled, the Hexen sound curve is used instead, which allows players to hear sounds louder, farther away than usual.

name: Use old intermission screens/music
description: Use doom2.exe's original intermission screens/music.

name: Disable stealth monsters
description: Disable stealth monsters, since doom2.exe didn't have them.

name: old radius damage
description: If this is enabled, the original Doom radius damage code is used, i.e. explosions have infinite vertical range.

name: Disable crosshair
description: Players will not be able to use crosshair.

name: Old weapon switch
description: Players will be forced to switch weapons every time they pick up a new weapon.

name: Silent instant floors
description: Instantly moving floors are not silent

name: Sector sounds
description: Sector sounds use original method for sound origin.

name: Doom missile clip
description: Use original Doom heights for clipping against projectiles

name: Monster drop off
description: Monsters can't be pushed over dropoffs

name: Client side scripts (NET)
description: Uses Skulltag's old behavior when (NET) ACS Scripts are used. This is disabled by default, for compatibility among other ZDoom wads. If the WAD file is designed for Skulltag, and uses NET script advantages, then you would enable this feature.

name: Clients send full button info
description: This needs to be enabled to make the ACS function GetPlayerInput work on server side scripts with buttons other than BT_ATTACK, BT_USE, BT_JUMP, BT_CROUCH, BT_TURN180, BT_ALTATTACK, BT_RELOAD and BT_ZOOM. Because it increases net traffic, it should only be activated if needed.

name: No land
description: If this is enabled, players are not allowed to use the land CCMD.

name: Old random generator
description: If this is enabled, the original Doom random table is used to generate random integers in [0,255], which should make for instance the SSG cause a little more damage.

name: NOGRAVITY spheres
description:
This compatflag gives the specified spheres the NOGRAVITY flag, but only when they are spawned by the map.
Invulnerability Sphere
Mega Sphere
Soul Sphere
Blur Sphere

name: Don't stop player scripts on disconnect
description: If this is enabled, the ACS scripts with a player as activator are not terminated when this player disconnects.

name: Old explosion thrust
description: Enables the original (greater) horizontal explosion thrust.

name: Old bridge drops
description: If this is enabled, non-SOLID things (like flags) fall through invisible bridges.

name: Old jump physics
description: Enables the old ZDoom 1.23b33 jump physics.

name: No weapon switch cancellation
description: This flag disallows the ability to switch weapons while in the middle of A_Raise. Once the selected weapon starts its raising sequence, it cannot be cancelled.

name: West-facing spawns are silent
description: When set to true, players who spawn facing west are silent, as in vanilla Doom.

name: Limited movement in the air
description: By default, Zandronum gives players more maneuverability in the air than ZDoom. When this is true, ZDoom’s method is used. See Air Control for more precise details.

name: Plasma bump bug
description: Allows players to pick up items on the other side of solid walls by running into the wall at a specific angle. This flag should only be used for old vanilla Doom maps that really need it; it can have serious side effects on bridges and scrolling floors!

name: Allow instant respawn
description: Allows players to respawn instantly after being killed by holding down the "use" key when being hit.

name: Disable taunts
description: Prevents players from using the "taunt" command.

name: Original sound curve
description: Enabling this uses the original Doom sound curve, which causes sounds to fade away at a shorter distance. When disabled, the Hexen sound curve is used instead, which allows players to hear sounds louder, farther away than usual.

name: Use old intermission screens/music
description: Use doom2.exe's original intermission screens/music.

name: Disable stealth monsters
description: Disable stealth monsters, since doom2.exe didn't have them.

name: Old radius damage
description: If this is enabled, the original Doom radius damage code is used, i.e. explosions have infinite vertical range.

name: Disable crosshair
description: Players will not be able to use crosshair.

name: Old weapon switch
description: Players will be forced to switch weapons every time they pick up a new weapon.
